item.title: On-Premise 101 (Part 5): From Terraform VMs to a K8s Cluster with Ansible
item.author: xuanphuc.a1gv@gmail.com (Felix Hoang)
item.description: People are often scared to learn Kubernetes because it’s difficult to set up an environment to play around with. Sure, you can use a project like minikube to learn on your own, but running it on your laptop seems limited, and you may not get to experience all the awesome features Kubernetes offers (remember, it was born for high availability). Or, if you have money, you can use a managed Kubernetes cluster from one of the cloud providers. Often, they’ve abstracted away so many things under the hood that you only need to learn kubectl and you’re good to go.

item.title: Scalable Real-Time Credit Card Fraud Detection System
item.author: xuanphuc.a1gv@gmail.com (Felix Hoang)
item.description: This repository contains a complete end-to-end system for real-time credit card fraud detection, including data analysis notebooks, a machine learning API, and infrastructure-as-code for cloud deployment. The system is designed with a modern, observable, and scalable architecture.
